title: Taking on the Fed, Trump Combines Retribution Tactics With a Power Play
summary: The president’s second term has been marked by his eagerness to go after his foes and his assertions of presidential authority. Both traits are on display as he seeks control over the central bank.

title: Trump’s Attacks on the Fed and BLS Threaten Key Source of Economic Strength
summary: The president’s efforts to control the Federal Reserve and Bureau of Labor Statistics carry risks. But collectively, the moves could be even more damaging, economists warn.

title: Jay Powell Takes Center Stage with Friday’s Jackson Hole Address
summary: The Fed chief is expected to address inflation, interest rates and the economy in his speech on Friday. Will he also confront President Trump’s attacks on central bank independence?

title: How Trump Is Shaking Trust in the Economy, and Judge Orders ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ Shut Down
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Judge Orders ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ Detention Center in Florida to Shut Down for Now
summary: A judge ruled that the state and federal governments acted illegally by not conducting an environmental review before building the center in the Florida Everglades.

title: White House Lists Smithsonian Exhibits It Finds Objectionable
summary: The Trump administration highlighted material dealing with topics like sexuality, slavery and immigration.

title: Year Will End With 300,000 Fewer Federal Workers, Trump Official Says
summary: The reduction would be the largest single-year decline in civilian federal employment since World War II.

title: Gaza City and Surrounding Areas Officially Hit by Famine, Global Group Says
summary: At least half a million people in the enclave were facing the most severe conditions measured by U.N.-backed international experts: starvation, acute malnutrition and death.

title: 4 Takeaways From Erik Menendez’s Parole Board Hearing
summary: Lyle Menendez has his hearing Friday. Several of the concerns raised in denying parole to Erik suggest Lyle faces considerable hurdles in his own bid for release.

title: Erik Menendez Has Been Denied Parole. Here’s What to Know.
summary: A California parole panel said Mr. Menendez should not be released from prison, 36 years after he and his brother, Lyle, killed their parents. Lyle’s parole hearing is Friday.

title: ‘Flying Blind’: Trump Strips Government of Expertise at a High-Stakes Moment
summary: President Trump has few sources of independent advice just as he is trying to broker an end to the Russian invasion of Ukraine, perhaps the trickiest negotiation of his presidency.

title: The Crowdfunded War Map That Ukrainians Check Every Morning
summary: The online DeepState map, based on geolocated combat footage and tips from Ukrainian Army sources, draws 900,000 views each day and acts as a counterbalance to the military’s omissions.

title: Vance Recounts Telling Zelensky to ‘Behave’ in Trump Meeting
summary: It was not the first time that the vice president had addressed Ukraine’s leader with words more commonly spoken to toddlers than heads of state.

title: Newsom Signs California Redistricting Plan to Counter Texas Republicans
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom and Democratic state lawmakers moved quickly to create new districts that could help their party flip five congressional seats. Their plan still requires voter approval.

title: Congo Has Astronomical Rates of Sexual Violence. Now Victims Have Lost Access to Care.
summary: The conflict that has put rebels in control of  much of the east of the country has left victims with no legal recourse and dismantled many of the clinics that offered care.

title: A Critic of Universities Is Rallying to Defend Them in the Trump Era
summary: The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression has long been a critic of progressive campus culture. Now it’s taking on new, and surprising, targets.

title: Podcasting Is a Talent Business. SiriusXM Is Intent on Winning.
summary: The company famous for car radio and Howard Stern has recently climbed the podcast charts by betting hundreds of millions of dollars on shows like “Call Her Daddy” and “SmartLess.”

title: The Hobbyist Restorer Who Rocked the Art World With an A.I. Innovation
summary: Alex Kachkine spends his days working on microchip research — a skill set surprisingly similar to that needed for restoration.

title: Jeff Hiller Came Out of Nowhere. It Only Took 20 Years.
summary: His role in the dramatic HBO comedy “Somebody Somewhere” earned him his first Emmy nomination. It was also, more or less, his first major role.

title: Trump’s Gerrymandering Push Is a Form of Cheating
summary: Gerrymandering is a form of cheating. And it is preventable.

title: MAHA Is a Bad Answer to a Good Question
summary: Rachael Bedard and David Wallace-Wells on Covid disillusionment and the rise of the MAHA movement.

title: Collapsing Boundaries
summary: We look at the relationship between digital stars and their followers.

title: Nathaniel B. Palmer, a U.S. Icebreaker, May Have Sailed Its Last Expedition
summary: The decommissioning would leave the United States with no icebreaker to study the southern seas and cede scientific leadership to rival countries like China.

title: ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Has Everyone Bobbing Their Heads. Especially Parents.
summary: Some parents are reliving a golden era of boy bands and girl groups — “but now I’m handing out juice boxes instead of dancing like a rave with a glow stick,” one said.

title: Pair of Immigration Raids Disrupt a New Jersey Shipping Hub
summary: In Edison, thousands of immigrant workers toil in hundreds of warehouses, sorting millions of boxes arriving from nearby ports.

title: Red Envelopes With Cash Are Changing Hands at Adams Campaign Rallies
summary: New York Times reporters witnessed supporters of Mayor Eric Adams handing out cash-filled envelopes. Sometimes, that money went to reporters from Chinese-language outlets.
